intro: Carlowrightia pringlei, commonly known as the Pringle's carlowrightia, is a rare flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in rocky soils and is found in specific habitats such as chaparral and woodland areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a threatened species.
